meanings.definition: To gallop faster than someone or something else.
meanings.sent1: The horse was outgalloping the other horses in the race.
meanings.sent2: The cheetah was outgalloping the gazelle in the savanna.
meanings.sent3: The tortoise challenged the hare to a race, confident in outgalloping him.
meanings.sent4: Her heart was outgalloping her thoughts as she waited for the exam results.
meanings.sent5: The wind outgalloping the storm, clearing the skies in a rush.

meanings.definition: The act of galloping faster than someone or something else.
meanings.sent1: The outgalloping of the horse caught everyone's attention at the rodeo.
meanings.sent2: The outgalloping of the cheetah was a sight to behold in the wild.
meanings.sent3: The race was won by the outgalloping of the underdog, surprising everyone.
meanings.sent4: The outgalloping of time seemed to quicken as the deadline approached.
meanings.sent5: The outgalloping of the river over the rocks created a soothing sound.
